articles.headline: Activists Crashed Exxon’s Board, but Forcing Change Will Be Hard
articles.snippet: The tension between climate goals and lifting Exxon Mobil’s profits could make it difficult for activists to make progress.
articles.abstract: The tension between climate goals and lifting Exxon Mobil’s profits could make it difficult for activists to make progress.
articles.lead_paragraph: The growing urgency to address climate change and concerns about the financial performance of Exxon Mobil aligned this week to help activist investors place two directors on the company’s board.
articles.byline: By Peter Eavis and Clifford Krauss

articles.headline: Russia Appears to Carry Out Hack Through System Used by U.S. Aid Agency
articles.snippet: Senior Democrats said the latest attack, ahead of President Biden’s meeting with his Russian counterpart, demanded a stronger response.
articles.abstract: Senior Democrats said the latest attack, ahead of President Biden’s meeting with his Russian counterpart, demanded a stronger response.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A newly disclosed effort by Russian intelligence to hijack the email system of a United States government agency prompted leading Democrats on Friday to urge stronger action against Moscow for accelerating cyberattacks ahead of President Biden’s summit next month with President Vladimir V. Putin.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and Nicole Perlroth

articles.headline: How to Buy Happiness (Responsibly)
articles.snippet: The great reopening offers ample opportunity to lift your spirits if you have some money to spare. Here’s how to do it right.
articles.abstract: The great reopening offers ample opportunity to lift your spirits if you have some money to spare. Here’s how to do it right.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bring on the nationwide spending binge.
